London Postgraduate Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;9d9f1f9d.1503</link>   <description> Culture, Media and Creative Industries, King's College London Postgraduate Conference<br>Cultures in Disarray. CALL FOR PAPERS- Extended deadline!<br><br>Submission for Abstract- Extended to 1st of April<br>Notification of Acceptance- 15th of April<br>Full Paper Submission- OPTIONAL (4000 mins. considered to be published)<br><br>Keynote Speakers<br>Prof. Nick Couldry, Department of Media and Communications, London School of Economics and Political Science<br>Prof. Peter Dahlgren, Department of Communication and Media, Lund University<br>Prof. Elisabetta Lazzaro, Department of Cultural Management, Universit\ufffd\ufffd Libre de Bruxelles [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T14:07:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ya-Chiao Tu</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;9d9f1f9d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;4caaf592.1502">   <title>Deadline Reminder RGS-IBS AC2015 Uncalled for or Just (Un)Cool? Young People-Friendly Research Methods </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;4caaf592.1502</link>   <description> *Apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>This is a gentle reminder that the deadline for abstracts for the below session is tomorrow (14/02/2015).<br><br>Uncalled for or Just (Un)Cool? Young People-Friendly Research Methods<br><br>CFP Annual International Conference, Exeter, 2nd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th September, 2015.<br>Royal Geographical Society (RGS) with Institute of British Geographers (IBG)<br><br>Session sponsorship: Participatory Geographies Research Group [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T09:43:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Wilkinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;4caaf592.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;61b20fbf.1502">   <title>Call for Chapters: Community Filmmaking: Diversity, Innovation, Policy and Practice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;61b20fbf.1502</link>   <description> Call for Chapters: Community Filmmaking: Diversity, Innovation, Policy and Practice<br><br>Editors:<br><br>Sarita Malik (Sociology/Communications, Brunel University London) Caroline Chapain (Birmingham Business School, University of Birmingham) Roberta Comunian (Creative Industries, Kings College London)<br><br>The community arts movement of the 1960s and 1970s was based on the assumption that community-led activity was representative of the people, and thus merited public investment. Since then, community filmmaking has been a good example of community-led arts activity, often with a civic agenda, that lacks public investment. Research around the role of cinema and society has tended to focus on the mainstream film value chain, with [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-12T13:27:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Comunian, Roberta</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;61b20fbf.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;5832d21a.1502">   <title>Job Search realities in our field of study </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;5832d21a.1502</link>   <description> Dear CREATIVEINDUSTRIES educators and post graduate students,<br><br>Many job vacancies are posted to this network. With about 200 circa applicants for each post -<br>Is there any feedback on the selection process offered by recruiters?<br>Is there an over-supply of job applicants?<br>Are many Uni’s offering Graduate Employability embedded in the courses<br><br>I am interested to hear from anyone (please send me a private email at peter.regelous2007@my.ntu.ac.uk , rather than clogging upinet), who has applied in the last couple of years.<br>Please help to find out the reality of life for applicants out there on the network. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T10:31:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Regelous 2007 (N0238921)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;5832d21a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;f0b90d9b.1502">   <title>Final CFP RGS-IBG 2015: Uncalled for or Just (Un)Cool? Young People-Friendly Research Methods </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;f0b90d9b.1502</link>   <description> CFP RGS-IBS AC2015<br>Apologies for cross-posting<br>Final call for papers<br><br>Uncalled for or Just (Un)Cool? Young People-Friendly Research Methods<br><br>CFP Annual International Conference, Exeter, 2nd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th September, 2015.<br>Royal Geographical Society (RGS) with Institute of British Geographers (IBG)<br><br>Session sponsorship: Participatory Geographies Research Group<br><br>Modifying Punch\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds (2002) question, this session asks: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdis doing research with young people different from doing research with children, or adults?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd In recent decades, scholarship has emerged which presents young people as more than adults-in-waiting (Matthews et al., 1998), seeing them instead as agentic beings and social and spatial actors in their own right (e.g. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T09:48:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Wilkinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;f0b90d9b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;561c22ff.1501">   <title>Culture in Disarray: Destruction/ Reconstruction Postgraduate Conference 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;561c22ff.1501</link>   <description> CALL FOR PAPERS<br>Keynote Speakers<br>Prof. Nick Couldry, Department of Media and Communications,<br>London School of Economics and Political Science<br>Prof. Peter Dahlgren, Department of Communication and Media, Lund University<br><br>Cultures are in disarray as never before assaulted and undermined by a complex mix of alienating ideology and transformational technologies. Is culture craving for a paradigm shift? Or is this state of disarray just another moment of re-construction within culture? Looking at culture not just as a concept, we can understand it as being permanently reconfigured, in a constant process of adaptation and symbiosis with social and economic developments, reflecting [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-24T19:16:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ya-Chiao Tu</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;561c22ff.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;2bd97245.1501">   <title>Cultural Politics Volume 10.3: Free Access Issue </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;2bd97245.1501</link>   <description> From: Armitage J.<br>Sent: 13 January 2015 09:29<br>Subject: Cultural Politics Volume 10.3: Free Access Issue<br><br>Dear all<br><br>The latest issue of Cultural Politics, Volume 10, Number 3, November 2014, featuring cover art and an essay by New York artist Mira Schor has just been published.<br><br>This entire issue, featuring articles by, among others, Chris Hables Gray, Sean Cubitt, Elspeth Probyn, WSA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Jussi Parikka, Geoffrey Winthrop-Young, and Kevin Robins is available open access, courtesy of Duke University Press. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T09:33:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roberts J.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;2bd97245.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;b12a7447.1411">   <title>Neurocreator - new magazine </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;b12a7447.1411</link>   <description> *apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural edition of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking<br>at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework<br>therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach<br>that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very<br>old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods!<br>Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative<br>process? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-27T13:08:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mal Williamson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;b12a7447.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;67de917d.1410">   <title>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Creative Economy", the Acropolis Museum in Athens, 18/10/2014</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;67de917d.1410</link>   <description> &quot;The Creative Economy&quot;<br><br>ELPIS (http://elpis.org.gr) is very pleased to be organizing the international event, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Creative Economy \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd an Infinite Opportunity for Growth,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd on October 18th, 2014 at the Acropolis Museum in Athens, Greece.<br><br>The event, which elpis is organizing in partnership with the British Council, launches the Greek translation of Felipe Buitrago Restrepo and Iv\ufffd\ufffdn Duque’s, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Orange Economy \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd An Infinite Opportunity\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, an important study on Creative Economy in the Caribbean region and Latin America which was published in 2013 by the Inter-American Development Bank. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-14T21:39:41+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Georgios Zifkos</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;67de917d.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;1d5debb6.1410">   <title>Literature and the Creative Economy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;1d5debb6.1410</link>   <description> [Description: Literature and the Creative Economy]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/literature-and-the-creative-economy&gt;Literature and the Creative Economy&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/literature-and-the-creative-economy&gt;<br>Sarah Brouillette<br><br>&quot;Sarah Brouillete's Literature and the Creative Economy is a potentially pathbreaking work that does not simply critique the idea of the creative economy, but rather shows us how it actually works-most innovatively, in the changes it has produced in the institution of literature itself.&quot;-Nicholas Brown, University of Illinois at Chicago [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-14T12:03:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;1d5debb6.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;b2e1932f.1409">   <title>Cross Innovation Final Conference, 16/17 October 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;b2e1932f.1409</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Birmingham City University will be holding an international conference on cross innovation from Thursday 16th to Friday 17th October 2014, exploring how the creative industries collaborate with other sectors to generate new thinking.<br><br>Places are free and registration is through Eventbrite: http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/cross-innovation-final-conference-and-blender-workshop-tickets-7084757701<br><br>Programme<br><br>Day 1: Final Conference, Birmingham City University Parkside Campus, Birmingham B4 7XG, Thursday 16th October 2014, 12 noon - 4pm [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-24T14:56:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Cahill-Jones</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;b2e1932f.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;7da4da6f.1409">   <title>Call for Papers: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCulture, market and society. Between marketization of culture and culturalization of market\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;7da4da6f.1409</link>   <description> Call for Papers: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCulture, market and society. Between marketization of culture and culturalization of market\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, special issue of International Review of Social Research, Volume 5, Issue 1, February 2015<br>Guest editors: Philippe Chantepie (Ecole Polytechnique-Telecom Paris-Tech / Orange), Anda Becu\ufffd\ufffd (National Institute for Research and Cultural Training), Dan Eugen Ra\ufffd\ufffdiu (Babe\ufffd\ufffd-Bolyai University) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-23T08:48:19+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anda Becut</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;7da4da6f.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;2b46156e.1409">   <title>Training: Autumn-Winter dates Digital Video Production weekend </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;2b46156e.1409</link>   <description> Hi all,<br><br>**Apologies for cross-posting** Are you teaching film but what to learn more about the practical side? Or, do you just want to develop some video production skills for your own project? Spectacle offers affordable weekend digital video production training, either in London on one of our scheduled courses, or another time at your university/organisation if you have a group of 5 or more participants. So far we have completed training at Universities of Cambridge and Lancaster, the Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research, Contested Cities Network etc - please see more info here: http://www.spectacle.co.uk/projects_page.php?id=512 If you would like [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-02T15:11:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>training@spectacle.co.uk</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;2b46156e.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;36deda76.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;760d7b2a.1408">   <title>Save the date: RSA event for design tutors, 17 September </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;760d7b2a.1408</link>   <description> Hi all,<br><br>Apologies for cross-posting \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd just a quick heads up to say that the RSA Student Design Awards 2014/15 curriculum (comprised of 8 design briefs, focused on real-world social, environmental and economic challenges) will launch on Monday 1st September at http://sda.thersa.org<br><br>Design tutors who are interested in using the RSA briefs in their curriculum are invited to our 2014/15 Launch + Tutor briefing event, from 2-6pm on Wednesday 17th September at the RSA in London. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-13T16:55:33+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rebecca Ford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;760d7b2a.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;e24e6b5.1407">   <title>Rideout Conference & Workshop - Final Reminder </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;e24e6b5.1407</link>   <description> Later this month, Rideout are hosting two special events.<br><br>1. Where Does Talent Come From? - A one-day conference on 23 July 2014 at the Hyatt Regency in Birmingham UK exploring the origins of talent and strategies for nurturing its development. Speakers include Germaine Greer and BBC Radio 4's Tim Harford along with other experts from psychology, the arts and criminal justice. Discount rates maybe available upon request. Full details here http://bit.ly/1hbPCyF [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-09T14:37:11+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Saul Hewish</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;e24e6b5.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;ecf9c387.1406">   <title>2014-15 Training: Digital Video Production courses </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;ecf9c387.1406</link>   <description> Hi all,<br>**Apologies for cross-posting**<br>Spectacle is an award winning independent television production company specialising in documentary, community-led investigative journalism and participatory media. We offer affordable weekend training in Digital Video Production, Digital Video Production for Anthropologists and Social Researchers, Final Cut Pro editing, Copyright for filmmakers, Low / No budget filmmaking, and Documentary Research. We have recently launched a 4-day Filmmaking workshop aimed at giving you 'real-world' experience in making a short film from start to finish - with our next dates 21 - 24 August, 27 - 30 Nov and 5 - 8 Feb. As a small, socially-minded [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-27T13:34:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Irma Allen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;ecf9c387.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;6c90d6c9.1406">   <title>Creative Citizens Conference Programme Published </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;6c90d6c9.1406</link>   <description> CREATIVE CITIZENS<br>Sept 18 &amp; 19 at the Royal College of Art, London.<br><br>The Creative Citizens Conference Programme is now out !<br><br>We have more than 30 papers, four great keynotes, a policy forum, and workshops on Value, Knowledge and Global Creative Citizenship. The conference will also launch the findings of a 20 month research project into Creative Citizenship, it will host a new exhibition and a News Caf\ufffd\ufffd to keep the discussion rolling. All on Sept 18 &amp; 19 at the Royal College of Art London. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-25T12:28:12+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Dovey</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;6c90d6c9.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;831b1922.1406">   <title>Opportunities in Department of Media, Coventry University </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;831b1922.1406</link>   <description> Opportunities in the Department of Media, Coventry University<br><br>As a result of internal promotions and course expansion, we have a series of exciting opportunities for imaginative, proactive individuals who can respond creatively to the changing landscape of higher education and make a distinctive contribution to the work of the Department.<br><br>Associate Head of Department, Media (Partnerships Internationalisation and External Engagement - Closing date 25/07/2014<br>Senior Lecturer in Connected/Networked Digital Media - Closing date 18/07/2014<br>Senior Lecturer in Media &amp; Communications and Course Leader - Closing date 18/07/2014<br>Senior Lecturer in Photography and Course Leader - Closing date 18/07/2014 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-25T07:42:00+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Woodbridge</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;831b1922.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;c39507da.1406">   <title>Film + Video Post Production Training </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CREATIVEINDUSTRIES;c39507da.1406</link>   <description> Upcoming courses in film + video editing, motion graphics, animation, vfx and much more.<br><br>FINAL CUT PRO X ADVANCED - SAT 21 JUNE - LONDON<br>This one-day, hands-on course will teach you advanced editing, compositing, grading and finishing techniques, covering motion tracking, colour and shape matte creation, multi-cam clip editing, blue + green screen keying techniques, compositing modes, primary and secondary colour correction, audio mixing and 5:1 Surround Sound editing, advanced workflows for managing media, and Master output using Compressor.
